Summary: Hire and lead a team of high-caliber data scientists with superb academic credentials and proven industry expertise in marketing, customer, and digital data…
Description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.Job CategoryProducts and TechnologyJob DetailsSalesforce is embarking on our own Digital Transformation to deliver success for our customers and accelerate our growth. As every Digital Transformation is also a Data Transformation, we’re investing in scaling our data science capabilities in our Marketing Decision Science group.We’re looking for an experienced Data Science leader who can drive the ideation, design, development, and deployment of machine learning algorithms and statistical techniques to enhance our digital experiences and improve the effectiveness of our marketing spend. This leader will hire and lead a team of data scientists who will develop algorithms such as propensity models, causal models, multi-touch attribution models, recommendation systems, and similar approaches for a range of marketing, customer engagement, and digital use cases.This leader brings significant expertise in designing, developing, and delivering data science algorithms for marketing and digital use cases on large-scale data sets in a cloud environment. They show rigor in how they prototype, test, and evaluate algorithm performance both in the testing phase of algorithm development and in managing production algorithms. They demonstrate advanced knowledge of statistics along with ensuring the ethical use of data in the algorithm design process. At Salesforce, Trust is our number one value and we expect all applications of AI and machine learning to adhere to our values and policies to ensure we balance business needs with responsible uses of technology.This is a highly visible role with a potentially outsized impact on significant annual investments in marketing and digital programs and the ability to directly influence the Salesforce product roadmap as customer zero for our suite of cloud data products.ResponsibilitiesLead the Data Science practice for the Salesforce Marketing Decision Science organization to drive the design and delivery of a portfolio of algorithms for marketing and digital use casesOwn the full lifecycle of algorithm development from ideation and data exploration, algorithm design and testing, algorithm development and deployment, to algorithm monitoring and tuning in production.Hire and lead a team of high-caliber data scientists with superb academic credentials and proven industry expertise in marketing, customer, and digital data science use cases.Manage a suite of data science tools/platforms and inform future investments in data science technology needed for collaborative data exploration, algorithm design, and algorithm deploymentLead a team culture of critical thinking, creativity, innovation, experimentation, diversity, and inclusivity that aligns with Salesforce's core values and enriches the impact, careers, and learning opportunities across the Digital team.Be a master in cross-functional collaboration by developing deep relationships with key partners across the company and coordinating with working teams.Build and maintain the team brand both internally (speaking in Executive forums, evangelizing on internal social networks) and externally (speaking at industry events, blogs).Constantly learn, have a clear pulse on innovation across the enterprise SaaS, AdTech, paid media, data science, customer data, and analytics communities.Required SkillsMaster’s or Ph.D. in Math or Technology (computer science, computer engineering, economics, applied math, statistics, engineering, or other quantitative fields)15-20+ years experience in the data field with at least 10+ years experience developing and applying advanced statistical techniques for business impact. Must have multiple, robust examples of using data science approaches to solve business problems on large-scale data sets.10+ years of experience designing and delivering algorithms for Fortune 100 organizations. Must have proven experience developing machine learning products and deploying to production use cases for marketing, customer, or digital needs.5-10+ years of experience building and managing data science teams including recruitment, role design, work design, and talent management.Strong data manipulation and database modeling skills. Must be proficient in SQL, understand how to design and evaluate data models, and have the ability to closely partner with data engineers and architects to leverage data systems to create new algorithms and machine learning models.Broad understanding of digital marketing analytics and the role of digital analytics in evaluating the performance of campaigns, events, paid media, e-commerce, social media, etc. Must have proven expertise designing analytical models such as cohorts, attribution models, customer lifetime value models, causal models, propensity models, etc.Understanding of governmental privacy regulations on the collection and use of customer data (such a GDPR and CCPA) and how this impacts the development of data science products.Proven experience working directly with senior executive leadership and ability to lead significant programs with market impact across multiple business units and/or companies.An expert communicator in written and verbal form; ability to work well with executives, technologists, and able to lead and influence across all levels of the organization.Inspiring leader with a driven, results-focused attitude that is able to drive multiple large initiatives concurrently across cross-functional teams (Product, Engineering, Customer Success, Product Marketing, SIs, and more).Proven experience recruiting and mentoring world-class technology and data talentStrategic problem-solver who simplifies problems to their core elements and finds creative solutions.A get-it-done mindset with a strong bias towards action.Advanced Salesforce product knowledge a plus.B2B customer data experience a big plusAccommodationsIf you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.Posting StatementAt Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesfore.com or Salesforce.org.Salesforce welcomes all.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Summary: Experience with numerous machine learning/deep learning models such as neural networks, LSTM, autoencoder, anomaly detection. Azure ADLS or AWS S3.
Description: Senior Data ScientistOur client’s Data Intelligence Hub builds AI and data analytics solutions to uncover business insights, transforming into the intelligent company of tomorrow. With access to massive amounts of vehicle and automation telematics data, we develop data science solutions to improve our products, streamline manufacturing, and perfect the customers' experience. This position is currently working remotely, but will eventually be an onsite position.In this exciting and challenging role as Data Scientist, you will drive the development of innovative new products using advanced machine learning and artificial intelligence. You will leverage multiple enterprise data platforms, high volume IoT data, and associated tools for process automation, ELT/ETL, job management and code deployment. You are a highly motivated candidate who is willing to quickly learn and understand new technologies and tools. You will support, maintain, and deliver solutions, and scale the system to handle billions of events in near real-time.Senior Data Scientist ResponsibilitiesIdentify valuable data sources and automate collection processes.Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data.Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns.Use predictive modeling and machine learning to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, prospect targeting and other business outcomes.Present information using data visualization techniques.Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.Coordinate with different functional teams e.g. product development and/or engineering to implement models and monitor outcomes.Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.Extending companies data with third party sources of information when needed.Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems.Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis.Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner.Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance.Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.Actively work with internal and external customers to analyze business data needs, gather and document business and data architecture requirements.Develop, implement and maintain data pipelines with IoT data (Telematics, Factory Robotics).Perform data profiling, validation and acceptance testing for cloud integration.Ensure highest levels of data accessibility, security, and quality at all stages.Develop data and model pipelines with AzureML SDK, Azure Data factory, Databricks, Spark or related technologies.Develop rapid prototype proof of concept solutions for viability studies.Work within an Agile team and a dynamic, fast-moving, collaborative environment.Communicate status to all stakeholders.Keep current on latest data science technologies and products, including hands on evaluations and in-depth research.Senior Data Scientist QualificationsBachelor's degree in Technical or design field (Computer Science, Software Design, Full Stack Development, Electrical Engineering) or related field required. MBA or other related advanced degree preferred.BS/BA +6 years of experience Or applicable Master's degree + 4 years of experience.Should have excellent communication skills and ability to translate complex technical solutions to business executive in simple terms.Experience with numerous machine learning/deep learning models such as neural networks, LSTM, autoencoder, anomaly detection.Experience with Natural language processing.Experience with methods of business validation of ML models.Experience with statistical modeling and methods.Experience with team leadership-managing work across a small team of data scientists, analysts, engineers.Experience developing data pipelines for model training and validation.Experience developing end-to-end model prediction pipelines on live data.Experience deploying and managing large cloud compute workloads for optimal speed and cost efficiency.Experience with Spark and related technologies.Experience on major cloud analytics platforms AWS, Google or Azure (Azure preferred).Experience deploying machine learning solutions through to DevOps stage in a large, enterprise environment.Azure ADLS or AWS S3.Databricks or Jupyter.Python.PySpark or PyTorch.GitHub or similar collaborative dev hub.Experience in the manufacturing domain, especially product quality.Experience in automotive, especially aftermarket service and support.Experience with telematics IoT.BenefitsBenefits are available to eligible VanderHouwen contractors and include coverage for medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short and long term disability, and matching 401k.About VanderHouwenVanderHouwen is an award-winning, Women-Owned, WBENC certified professional staffing firm. Founded in 1987, VanderHouwen has been successfully placing experienced professionals throughout the Pacific Northwest and nationwide. Our recruitment teams are highly specialized in either Technology and IT, Engineering, or Accounting and Finance career markets. Our recruiters value building meaningful, professional relationships with each candidate as well as developing honed knowledge of companies' staffing needs and workplaces. Partner with us to land your next exciting career.VanderHouwen is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participates in E-Verify. VanderHouwen does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local, state or federal civil rights laws.
